User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the ServanaAI Landing application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

signUpDate.description: Date and time the user signed up.

definition.description: Stores user profile information.  The `userId` is the Firebase Authentication UID, ensuring path-based ownership.  All data under this path is private to the user.

params.name: userId
params.description: The Firebase Authentication UID of the user.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore structure prioritizes security and scalability for the ServanaAI Landing application by adhering to the core design principles. It focuses on authorization independence, clarity, and predictable schema.

Authorization Independence:  The structure avoids `get()` calls in security rules by denormalizing authorization data where needed.  In this application, all user data is private, stored under `/users/{userId}`.  No collaborative data scenarios requiring denormalization of membership maps are present.

Structural Segregation: Each collection maintains a homogeneous security posture. User-specific data is stored under their respective user ID.

Access Modeling: The structure uses path-based ownership (`/users/{userId}/...`) for private user data.  This makes security rules straightforward, based solely on `request.auth.uid`.

Data Clarity and Predictability:  The schema is explicit and predictable.
